properties.abstract: The sunbathed Weissenberge terrace above Sernftal is the starting and end point of this tour, which describes a larger or smaller circle. Depending on your fitness or the weather you can visit two or three summits along the way. On very clear autumn days the reason why the summit is called „Gulder“ (golden) becomes obvious: the rock on the summit is coloured golden-yellow.
properties.subtitle: On the move in the golden horseshoe
properties.title: From Weissenberge via Fuggfurggle - Sonnenhorn

sac_photos.title: The picturesque landscape on the ascent to Fuggfurggle (centre of the photo)
Traversing the east face on a faint path; to the very right is Gulderstock.

segments.description: From the Weissenberge summit station follow the marked mountain hiking path to Skihaus Fitterenstäfeli (P. 1759). On a faint path ascend to Fugboden.
segments.title: Weissenberge - Skihaus Fitterenstäfeli - Fugboden

segments.description:
From Fugboden ascend in increasingly steep pastures to Fuggfurggle (2283 m). Follow the ridge north-westward, bypassing rocky passages. Below P. 2480 descend a few metres on a faint path northward to traverse the steep west face of Gulderturm. Shortly before Gulderstock ascend to the ridge and in a few minutes you reach the summit. 
Descend on the ascent below Gulderturm, then go northward to ascend north of P. 2480 to reach the ridge. On a faint path branch off westward to P. 2432. Follow the ridge on a faint path and on scree (cairns) to P. 2246.
segments.title: Fugboden - Fuggfurggle - Gulderstock - Sonnenhorn

segments.description: Above P. 2246 (the ski summit of Sonnenhorn) a good path begins traversing Sonnenhorn and leading down to the narrow road close to P. 1903. From there hike back to the Weissenberge summit station on marked hiking trails. From Abedweid continue either on the ascent route or (slightly faster) make an arc westward via Ochsenbüel–Engisboden.
segments.title: Sonnenhorn - Weissenberge

segments.description: The aforementioned oval can be extended by traversing Fuggenstock: from Weissenberge follow the mountain hiking trail until P. 1663, then turn right to take the hiking trail north-eastward. Via P. 1786 go to Scheberegg, follow the ridge via P. 2178 to reach the foot of the steep south face of Fuggenstock. Now overcome the escarpment on a narrow path to reach the flat summit area (T4). From the summit descend on the very exposed north-west ridge (T5–6, I) to reach Fuggfurggle. The cliffs are avoided on the north at first, then more on the south.) Add 1½ h.
segments.title: Variant traversing Fuggenstock
